question.body: Give the p-value of the test and state your conclusions in context.

alternative.title: R
alternative.p: The p-value of the test is 0.012. The small p-value (in particular, smaller than .05) tells us that it would be quite unlikely (1.2% chance) to get data like those observed just by chance. The data, therefore provide enough evidence for us to conclude that there is a significant linear relationship among infants between vocalization right after birth (as measured by cry count) and IQ at age 3.

alternative.title: StatCrunch
